title: Pre-Service Teachers' Social Competency Development Program Through Proactive Coaching and Mentoring

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary education foundational theories, basic classroom management knowledge, and foundational understanding of social relationship formation in educational settings
context.additional_context: Self-directed coaching/mentoring process for pre-service teachers to comprehensively enhance problem-solving skills, self-efficacy, and social relationship-building in educational settings. Special focus on cultivating citizenship in multicultural educational environments.

learning_goals: Within 8 weeks, learners enhance social interaction and classroom management competencies by 30% based on coaching feedback.
Learners interact with mentors ≥2 times monthly to develop ≥3 strategies for fostering citizenship and building relationships in actual classroom situations.
By course completion, learners achieve ≥4.0/5.0 on self-efficacy surveys and strengthen social responsibility in educational settings.

Applying knowledge from coaching (feedback techniques, goal-setting frameworks, etc.), learners complete a project-based case study for a group of 3–5 learners, achieving an average ≥4.0 (5-point scale) on peer and instructor rubrics (5 criteria: content relevance, feasibility, social value creation, effectiveness, cultural sensitivity).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
